bibl.title: Letter from Florence M. Read to Henry Rose Carter, June 28, 1924

div1.p: Read thanks Carter for his comments on Hoffmann's work. Read reports that Hanson is convinced there is no yellow fever in Colombia at the moment.

June 28, 1924
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
It was very good of you to write me fully in your letter
of June 22 about Doctor Hoffman's question of the presence of lime
casts in the kidney as determining the diagnosis of yellow fever.
I did not know how seriously to take this suggestion and so, as usual,
turned to you for advice.

I was interested to have your memorandum stating that rail-
road construction work is to be undertaken between Puerto Wilches and
Bucaramanga. Doctor Hanson seems quite convinced that there is at
the present time no yellow fever in Colombia. It will be of great
advantage as evidence to have the matter tested by such an influx of
non-immunes.
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely, Florence M. Read Doctor Henry R. Carter,
2122 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
